thread.title: Applications open for Women and Change Grant in Australia
thread.title_full: Applications open for Women and Change Grant in Australia

author: fundsforNGOs
title: Applications open for Women and Change Grant in Australia
text:
Deadline: 25-Jul-25
The Women and Change is accepting applications for its grant to support vulnerable Queenslanders.
They are interested in projects that deliver sustainable change and are particularly interested in supporting new initiatives.
Funding Information
Women& Change provide $50,000 grants- Funds should be applied to a project that is completed within 12 months of receiving the grant monies.
Eligibility Criteria
- Applications are open to charitable organisations that:
- have both Deductible Gift Recipient 1 (DGR1) and Tax Concessional Charity status (TCC), from the Australian Taxation Office.
- propose projects that are Queensland based, with grant funds primarily helping Queenslanders experiencing disadvantage and in need of support.
- are based in
Australia(with majority of funds to be spent in Queensland).
- Only charities that meet the above criteria are eligible to apply.
- The project must be completed in the calendar year following Voting Night.
- The successful applicant must provide progress reports at six months and a final report at 12 months. Outcomes must be shared with the members of Women & Change.
- Applicants can apply for part funding of a larger project, as long as the balance of funds is confirmed and the project is ready to commence.
- Women & Change will consider applications for any demonstrable need, including operational, infrastructure or capacity-building support, where it is clear that philanthropic funding will make a tangible and measurable difference to the quality of life of the individuals and communities in Queensland.
Ineligibility Criteria
- Grants will not be awarded to or for: individuals; political parties; government entities; commercial sponsorships; religious groups (except for projects that support a non-religious purpose); retrospective requests; debt retirement, budget deficits, endowments or bequest programs; or general
fundraisingappeals.
For more information, visit Women and Change.
